text: == Events == === Africa === * Conflict between the independent republics of Mahdia and Gabes in Ifriqiya. Madhia is supported by the Zirid dynasty while Gabes receives the aid of the Roger I of Sicily. === Asia === * Pelusium is destroyed by Baldwin I of Jerusalem. * Miidera and the sohei of Enryakuji attack Nara, Japan. === Europe === * Borivoj II of Bohemia becomes prince in place of Vladislav I of Bohemia. * The people of Santiago de Compostela (present-day Spain) try to burn their prelate in his palace, along with the queen. * Iceland ends slavery. * Short-lived Almoravid reconquest of Coimbra (Portugal).Gilbert Meynier (2010) L'Algérie cœur du Maghreb classique. De l'ouverture islamo-arabe au repli (658-1518). Paris: La Découverte; pp.84. == By topic == === Education === * May 3 - Merton Priory (Thomas Becket School) is consecrated. === Technology === * The earliest use of a compass for navigational purposes is recorded. == Births == * Humphrey II of Toron, Constable of Jerusalem == Deaths == * April 16 - Saint Magnus, Earl of Orkney (executed) * December 9 - Gertrud of Brunswick, Markgräfin of Meißen * Anselm of Laon, French theologian * Ivo of Chartres, French canon lawyer (b. 1040) * Bertrade de Montfort, wife of Fulk IV of Anjou and Philip I of France * Li Zhiyi, Chinese poet == References ==
